tool.name: velvetg
tool.command:
velvetg_jgi_wrapper.pl $velveth.extra_files_path $velvetg_outfile.extra_files_path $velvetg_outfile $contigs_outfile $stats_outfile $lastgraph_outfile $unused_reads_outfile $amos_outfile $kmer
velvetg $velvetg_outfile.extra_files_path -very_clean yes
#if $insLenSelect : -ins_length $ins_length #if $insLenSDSelect: -ins_length_sd $ins_length_sd #end if #end if
#if $insLenSelect2 : -ins_length2 $ins_length2 #if $insLenSDSelect2: -ins_length2_sd $ins_length_sd2 #end if #end if
#if $insLenSelect3 : -ins_length3 $ins_length3 #if $insLenSDSelect3: -ins_length3_sd $ins_length_sd3 #end if #end if
#if $insLenSelect4 : -ins_length4 $ins_length4 #if $insLenSDSelect4: -ins_length4_sd $ins_length_sd4 #end if #end if
#if $insLenSelect5 : -ins_length5 $ins_length5 #if $insLenSDSelect5: -ins_length5_sd $ins_length_sd5 #end if #end if
#if $insLenSelectLong : -ins_length_long $ins_lengthLong #end if
#if $exp_cov_input.exp_selection == "Manual" : -exp_cov $exp_cov_input.exp_cov #else : -exp_cov `egrep "^$kmer" $exp_cov_input.exp_cov_file | cut -f2`
#end if
#if $cov_cutoff_condition.cov_cutoff_select == "yes" : -cov_cutoff $cov_cutoff_condition.cov_cutoff #end if
#if $long_cov_cutoff_condition.long_cov_cutoff_select == "yes" : -long_cov_cutoff $long_cov_cutoff_condition.long_cov_cutoff #end if
#if $max_coverage_condition.max_coverage_select == "yes":
-max_coverage $max_coverage
#end if
#if $min_contig_lgth_condition.min_contig_lgth_select == "yes" :
-min_contig_lgth $min_contig_lgth
#end if
#if $read_trkg:
-read_trkg $read_trkg
#end if
#if $amos_file:
-amos_file $amos_file
#end if
#if $unused_reads:
-unused_reads $unused_reads
#end if
#if $max_branch_length_condition.max_branch_length_select == "yes":
-max_branch_length $max_branch_length
#end if
#if $max_divergence_condition.max_divergence_length_select == "yes":
-max_divergence $max_divergence
#end if
#if $max_gap_count_condition.max_gap_count_select == "yes":
-max_gap_count $max_gap_count
#end if #if $scaffolding : -scaffolding $scaffolding
#end if
#if $long_mult_cutoff_condition.long_mult_cutoff_select == "yes" :
-long_mult_cutoff $long_mult_cutoff
#end if
#if $min_pair_count_condition.min_pair_count_select =="yes":
-min_pair_count $min_pair_count
#end if
#if $alignments:
-alignments $alignments
#end if
#if $exportFiltered:
-exportFiltered $exportFiltered
#end if

param.name: velveth
param.label: velvet hash

param.name: kmer
param.label: What kmer do you want to run the velvetg job on ?

param.name: insLenSelect
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the first data set?

param.name: ins_length
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: insLenSDSelect
param.label: Do you want to enter a length standard deviation (bp) of short library for the first data set?

param.name: ins_length_sd
param.label: [ins_length_sd] Insert length standard deviation (bp) of short library; requires above
param.help: blank=default of 10% of corresponding length; auto=infer; or supply value (integer)

param.name: insLenSelect2
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the second data set?

param.name: ins_length2
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: insLenSDSelect2
param.label: Do you want to enter a length standard deviation (bp) of short library for the second data set?

param.name: ins_length_sd2
param.label: [ins_length_sd] Insert length standard deviation (bp) of short library; requires above
param.help: blank=default of 10% of corresponding length; auto=infer; or supply value (integer)

param.name: insLenSelect3
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the third data set?

param.name: ins_length3
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: insLenSDSelect3
param.label: Do you want to enter a length standard deviation (bp) of short library for the third data set?

param.name: ins_length_sd3
param.label: [ins_length_sd] Insert length standard deviation (bp) of short library; requires above
param.help: blank=default of 10% of corresponding length; auto=infer; or supply value (integer)

param.name: insLenSelect4
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the fourth data set?

param.name: ins_length4
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: insLenSDSelect4
param.label: Do you want to enter a length standard deviation (bp) of short library for the fourth data set?

param.name: ins_length_sd4
param.label: [ins_length_sd] Insert length standard deviation (bp) of short library; requires above
param.help: blank=default of 10% of corresponding length; auto=infer; or supply value (integer)

param.name: insLenSelect5
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the fifth data set?

param.name: ins_length5
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: insLenSDSelect5
param.label: Do you want to enter a length standard deviation (bp) of short library for the fifth data set?

param.name: ins_length_sd5
param.label: [ins_length_sd] Insert length standard deviation (bp) of short library; requires above
param.help: blank=default of 10% of corresponding length; auto=infer; or supply value (integer)

param.name: insLenSelectLong
param.label: Do you want to enter an expected distance between two paired end reads for the long data set?

param.name: ins_lengthLong
param.label: [-ins_length] Insert length (bp) of short library

param.name: exp_cov
param.label: [-exp_cov] Expected short read k-mer coverage
param.help: auto=infer it; or supply value (real number)

param.name: exp_cov_file
param.label: Input from the expected kmer coverage tool
param.help: Note can only accept 1 kmer will always run on the first kmer in the file.

param.name: cov_cutoff_select
param.label: Enter the coverage cutoff to remove low coverage nodes after tour bus or allow the system to infer it ?

param.name: cov_cutoff
param.label: [-cov_cutoff] Removal of low coverage nodes AFTER tour bus
param.help: auto=infer cutoff; or specify cutoff (real number)

param.name: long_cov_cutoff_select
param.label: Remove nodes with low long-read coverage after tour bus ?

param.name: long_cov_cutoff
param.label: [-long_cov_cutoff] Removal of low long-read coverage nodes AFTER tour bus

param.name: max_coverage_select
param.label: Remove high coverage nodes after tour bus ?

param.name: max_coverage
param.label: [-max_coverage] Exclude highly covered data from your assembly (e.g. plasmid, mitochondrial, and chloroplast sequences)

param.name: min_contig_lgth_select
param.label: Set the minimum contigs length exported to contigs.fa (default:hash length * 2) ?

param.name: min_contig_lgth
param.label: Minimum contig length

param.name: scaffolding
param.label: Scaffolding

param.name: max_branch_length_select
param.label: Set the maximum length in the base pair of bubble (default 100) ?

param.name: max_branch_length
param.label: Maximum branch length

param.name: max_divergence_length_select
param.label: Set the maximum divergence rate between two branches in bubble?

param.name: max_divergence
param.label: Maximum divergence rate

param.name: max_gap_count_select
param.label: Set maximum number of gaps allowed in the alignment of two branches of a bubble (default: 3) ?

param.name: max_gap_count
param.label: Maximum gap count

param.name: long_mult_cutoff_select
param.label: Set the minimum number of reads required to merge contigs (default 2) ?

param.name: long_mult_cutoff
param.label: Minimum long read connection cutoff

param.name: min_pair_count_select
param.label: Set the mimum paired end connections to justify the scaffolding of two long contigs(default: 5) ?

param.name: min_pair_count
param.label: Minimum Read-Pair Validation

param.name: unused_reads
param.label: Export unused reads

param.name: read_trkg
param.label: [-read_trkg] tracking of short read positions in assembly
param.help: This will cost slightly more memory and calculation time, but will have the advantage of producing in the end a more detailed description of the assembly. The additional information will be included in the LastGraph file and optionally the Amos assembly file (below).

param.name: amos_file
param.label: [-amos_file] export assembly to AMOS file
param.help: If selecting this option, you may also want to select -read_trkg (above)

param.name: alignments
param.label: [-alignments] export a summary of contig alignment to the reference sequences

param.name: exportFiltered
param.label: [-exportFiltered] export the long nodes which were eliminated by the coverage filters

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool assembles contigous sequences from preprocessed reads by constructing a de Bruijn graph.
Sequences must be preprocessed by the velveth tool.
**Manual**
http://www.ebi.ac.uk/~zerbino/velvet/Manual.pdf
